intro: Corispermum aralocaspicum subsp. caucasicum, commonly known as the Caucasian corispermum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is a small annual herb characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is adapted to arid and saline environments, thriving in regions with limited water availability. Its distribution is primarily in the Caucasus region, where it grows in dry, sandy soils.
